newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech President Havel marries actress.
newsitem.headline: Czech President Havel marries actress.

text.p: Czech President Vaclav Havel married actress Dagmar Veskrnova in a private ceremony on Saturday, his office confirmed.
"The (civil) wedding was performed in the absence of public and media at the Municipality of Prague 3. Only two witnesses... and Mrs. Veskrnova's daughter were present," an official statement said.

Veskrnova, 44, is a popular TV, theatre and film actress with a full-time job in one of Prague's leading theatres. She has been divorced since 1980 and has a 20-year-old daughter from her first marriage.
Havel, 60, a former dissident playwright who became president after the overthrow of communism in 1989, is a widower. His wife Olga died of cancer last January after 32 years of marriage.
In his traditional New Year's speech he spoke of Olga, to whom he wrote numerous letters from jail that were published as a book in the West, as hid "closest human being".

Havel left hospital late last month several weeks after an operation to remove a malignant tumour from his lungs. He contracted pneumonia soon afterwards and had to be connected to a respirator. Doctors say his condition has been improving steadily.
